00011 #difference between sets and lists in python
00012 #Sets can't contain duplicates
00013 #Sets are unordered
00014 #In order to find an element in a set, a hash lookup is used (which is why sets are unordered). 
00015 #This makes __contains__ (in operator) a lot more efficient for sets than lists.
00016 #Sets can only contain hashable items (see #3). If you try: set(([1],[2])) you'll get a TypeError.
00017 # --- in python arrays are called lists

00020 class Apriori:
00021     returnPlace1 = "returnPlace1 " + " returnPlace2"
00022     def __init__(this, data, minSupport, minConfidence):
00023         this.dataset = data
00024         this.placeList = defaultdict(list)
00025         this.freqList = defaultdict(int)
00026         this.placeset = set()
00027         this.highSupportList = list()
00028         this.numplaces = 0
00029         this.prepData()            
00030 
00031         this.FirstPass = defaultdict(list)
00032         this.minSupport = minSupport
00033         this.minConfidence = minConfidence
00034 
00035     def generateAssociations(this):
00036                 #associations occur when one item is purchased with another 
00037                 #or one location is queried with another
00038         candidate = {}
00039         count = {}
00040 
00041         this.FirstPass[1] = this.onePass(this.freqList, 1)
00042         k=2
00043         while len(this.FirstPass[k-1]) != 0:
00044             candidate[k] = this.candidateGen(this.FirstPass[k-1], k)
00045             for t in this.placeList.iteritems():
00046                 for c in candidate[k]:
00047                     if set(c).issubset(t[1]):
00048                         this.freqList[c] += 1
00049                         #prune the candidates on the first pass
00050             this.FirstPass[k] = this.prune(candidate[k], k)
00051             if k > 2:
00052                 this.removeSkyline(k, k-1)
00053             k += 1
00054 
00055         return this.FirstPass
00056 
00057     def removeSkyline(this, k, kPrev):
00058                 #removes bad 
00059                 #for each place in the first pass of this object
00060         for place in this.FirstPass[k]:
00061                         #generate subsets from the place
00062             subsets = this.genSubsets(place)
00063                         #for each subset in subsets, remove a subset if it is part of the previous subset
00064             for subset in subsets:
00065                 if subset in (this.FirstPass[kPrev]):
00066                     this.FirstPass[kPrev].remove(subset)
00067                     
00068 
00069         subsets = this.genSubsets
00070 
00071     def prune(this, places, k):
00072         f = []
00073                 #for each place in places
00074         for place in places:
00075                         #count is equal to return from freqList (place#)
00076             count = this.freqList[place]
00077                         #support is equal to float(count)/this.numplaces
00078             support = this.support(count)
00079                         #if count/number of places is greater than 95%, add the place to the highSupportList, otherwise
00080                         #just append to the regular places list
00081             if support >= .95:
00082                 this.highSupportList.append(place)
00083             elif support >= this.minSupport:
00084                 f.append(place)
00085                 #return the array of regular places and not highSupportList
00086         return f
00087 
00088     def candidateGen(this, places, k):
00089                 #declare candidate array for candidate generation
00090         candidate = []
00091 
00092         if k == 2:
00093                         #if k is 2
00094                         #a tuple is like a list enclosed in parenthesis - a list is enclosed in brackets
00095                         #this line assigns a candidate vis sorting x and y
00096             candidate = [tuple(sorted([x, y])) for x in places for y in places if len((x, y)) == k and x != y]
00097         else:
00098             candidate = [tuple(set(x).union(y)) for x in places for y in places if len(set(x).union(y)) == k and x != y]
00099         
00100         for c in candidate:
00101                         #for each candidate, generate a subset
00102             subsets = this.genSubsets(c)
00103                         #if x is not in places but is in subset, then remove
00104             if any([ x not in places for x in subsets ]):
00105                 candidate.remove(c)
00106                 #the candidate set is returned as a result of the candidateGeneration method
00107         return set(candidate)
00108 
00109     def genSubsets(this, place):
00110         subsets = []
00111         for i in range(1,len(place)):
00112                         #generate a subset
00113             subsets.extend(itertools.combinations(place, i))
00114         return subsets
00115 
00116     def support(this, count):
00117                 #return count/number of places in this this
00118         return float(count)/this.numplaces
00119 
00120     def onePass(this, places, k):
00121         op = []
00122                 #iterate counter count number of times in places
00123         for place, count in places.iteritems():
00124             support = this.support(count)
00125                         #if support is equal to one, add to the high support list
00126             if support == 1:
00127                 this.highSupportList.append(place)
00128                         #else if support is less than or equal to minimum support, add to the regular place list
00129             elif support >= this.minSupport:
00130                 op.append(place)
00131 
00132         return op
00133                 
00134                 
00135     def prepData(this):
00136         key = 0
00137                 # basket is another name for dictionary and looks like this: basket1 = {"ham":2,"eggs":3}
00138         for basket in this.dataset:
00139                         #increase the number of places for each basket of information {"Wiley's Bar and Grill", "bar"} would be one place
00140             this.numplaces += 1
00141             key = basket[0]
00142                         #for each element in the basket ie ham, 2, eggs, 3
00143             for i, place in enumerate(basket):
00144                 if i != 0:
00145                     this.placeList[key].append(place.strip())
00146                     this.placeset.add(place.strip())
00147                     this.freqList[(place.strip())] += 1
00148

00156     dataset = csv.reader(open('data/1000/1000-out1.csv', "r"))
00157     placesData = csv.reader(open('places.csv', "r"))
00158     minSupport  = float(.03)
00159     minConfidence = float(.7)
00160 
00161         #assign each place to an array value in python
00162         #this is the candidate itemset of size placesData
00163     for place in placesData:
00164         places[place[0]] = place[1:]
00165 
00166     a = Apriori(dataset, minSupport, minConfidence)
00167 
00168     #frequent itemset of size placesData
00169         # this line assigns a variable the outcome of the generateAssociations method for the a Apriori object
00170     frequentplacesets = a.generateAssociations()
00171 
00172     counter = 0
00173     counter2 = 0
00174     var = []
00175         
00176         #for (k=1; Lk !=0; k++) do begin
00177         #Ck + 1 = candidates generated from Lk;
00178     for k, place in frequentplacesets.iteritems():
00179         for i in place:
00180             if k >= 2:
00181                                 #increment the count of all candidates in Ck+1 that are contained in t
00182                 counter += 1
00183             placeStr = ''
00184                 #for each record append to item string
00185                 #placecount = 0
00186             for k, n in enumerate(i):
00187                 #placecount += 1
00188                 placeStr += places[n][0] + " "
00189                 if len(place) != 0 and k != len(place)-1:
00190                         placeStr += ",\t"               
00191                 global returnPlace1
00192                 returnPlace1 = placeStr
00193                         var.append(returnPlace1)
00194                 #print "returnPlace = " + returnPlace1  
00195         
00196                 
00197         printvar =(random.choice(var))
00198         print printvar
00199     return printvar

00244 def readable(item, goods):
00245     itemStr = ''
00246     for k, i in enumerate(item):
00247         itemStr += goods[i][0] + " " + goods[i][1] +" (" + i + ")"
00248         if len(item) != 0 and k != len(item)-1:
00249             itemStr += ",\t"
00250 
00251     return itemStr.replace("'", "")
